briefdescription.para: indicates whether spikes are not constrained to the grid
Table of pre-computed modulos.

detaileddescription.para:
This table is used to map time steps, given as offset from now, to ring-buffer bins. There are min_delay+max_delay bins in a ring buffer, and the moduli_ array is rotated by min_delay elements after each slice is completed.
RingBuffer

briefdescription.para: Table of pre-computed slice-based modulos.

detaileddescription.para:
This table is used to map time steps, give as offset from now, to slice-based ring-buffer bins. There are ceil(max_delay/min_delay) bins in a slice-based ring buffer, one per slice within max_delay. Since max_delay may not be a multiple of min_delay, we cannot simply rotate the table content after each slice, but have to recompute the table anew.
SliceRingBuffer

briefdescription.para: Register for node IDs of neurons that spiked.

detaileddescription.para:
This is a 4-dim structure. While spikes are written to the buffer they are immediately sorted by the thread that will later move the spikes to the MPI buffers.
First dim: write threads (from node to register)
Second dim: read threads (from register to MPI buffer)
Third dim: lag
Fourth dim: Target (will be converted in SpikeData)

briefdescription.para: Register for node IDs of precise neurons that spiked.

detaileddescription.para:
This is a 4-dim structure. While spikes are written to the buffer they are immediately sorted by the thread that will later move the spikes to the MPI buffers.
First dim: write threads (from node to register)
Second dim: read threads (from register to MPI buffer)
Third dim: lag
Fourth dim: OffGridTarget (will be converted in OffGridSpikeData)

briefdescription.para: Buffer to collect the secondary events after serialization.
Number of generated spike events (both off- and on-grid) during the last call to simulate.
whether size of MPI buffer for communication of connections was changed
whether size of MPI buffer for communication of spikes was changed
whether size of MPI buffer for communication of spikes can be decreased
Prepare manager for operation.

detaileddescription.para: After this method has completed, the manager should be completely initialized and "ready for action".

simplesect.para: Initialization of any given manager may depend on other managers having been initialized before. KernelManager::initialize() is responsible for calling the initialization routines on the specific managers in correct order.

briefdescription.para: Take down manager after operation.

detaileddescription.para: After this method has completed, all dynamic data structures created by the manager shall be deallocated and containers emptied. Plain variables need not be reset.

simplesect.para: Finalization of any given manager may depend on other managers not having been finalized yet. KernelManager::finalize() is responsible for calling the initialization routines on the specific managers in correct order, i.e., the opposite order of initialize() calls.

briefdescription.para: Change the number of threads.

detaileddescription.para: Many data structures within the different managers depend on the number of threads. This function is called on each manager upon a change of that number and allows the manager to re-allocate data structures accordingly.

briefdescription.para: Standard routine for sending events.

detaileddescription.para:
This method decides if the event has to be delivered locally or globally. It exists to keep a clean and unitary interface for the event sending mechanism.
Only specialization for SpikeEvent does remote sending. Specialized for DSSpikeEvent to avoid that these events are sent to remote processes.
send_local()

briefdescription.para: Send a secondary event remote.
Send event e to all targets of node source on thread t.
Add node ID of event sender to the spike_register.

detaileddescription.para: An event sent through this method will remain in the queue until the network time has advanced by min_delay_ steps. After this period the buffers are collocated and sent to the partner machines.

Old documentation from network.h: Place an event in the global event queue. Add event to the queue to be delivered when it is due. At the delivery time, the target list of the sender is iterated and the event is delivered to all targets. The event is guaranteed to arrive at the receiver when all elements are updated and the system is in a synchronised (single threaded) state.
send_to_targets()

briefdescription.para: Add node ID of event sender to the spike_register.

detaileddescription.para: Store event offset with node ID. An event sent through this method will remain in the queue until the network time has advanced by min_delay_ steps. After this period the buffers are collocated and sent to the partner machines.

Old documentation from network.h: Place an event in the global event queue. Add event to the queue to be delivered when it is due. At the delivery time, the target list of the sender is iterated and the event is delivered to all targets. The event is guaranteed to arrive at the receiver when all elements are updated and the system is in a synchronised (single threaded) state.
send_to_targets()

briefdescription.para: Send event e directly to its target node.

detaileddescription.para: This should be used only where necessary, e.g. if a node wants to reply to a *RequestEvent immediately.

briefdescription.para: return current communication style.

detaileddescription.para: A result of true means off_grid, false means on_grid communication.

briefdescription.para: set communication style to off_grid (true) or on_grid
Return 0 for even, 1 for odd time slices.

detaileddescription.para:
This is useful for buffers that need to be written alternatingly by time slice. The value is given by get_slice_() % 2.
read_toggle

briefdescription.para: Return 1 - write_toggle().

detaileddescription.para:
This is useful for buffers that need to be read alternatingly by slice. The value is given by 1-write_toggle().
write_toggle

briefdescription.para: Return (T+d) mod max_delay.
Index to slice-based buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Return ((T+d)/min_delay) % ceil(max_delay/min_delay).

briefdescription.para: Resize spike_register and comm_buffer to correct dimensions.

detaileddescription.para: Resizes also off_grid_*_buffer_. This is done by simulate() when called for the first time. The spike buffers cannot be reconfigured later, whence neither the number of local threads or the min_delay can change after simulate() has been called. ConnectorModel::check_delay() and Network::set_status() ensure this.

briefdescription.para: Collocates spikes from register to MPI buffers, communicates via MPI and delivers events to targets.
Collocates presynaptic connection information, communicates via MPI and creates presynaptic connection infrastructure.
Collocates presynaptic connection information for secondary events (MPI buffer offsets), communicates via MPI and create presynaptic connection infrastructure for secondary events.
Update table of fixed modulos, including slice-based.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called after all nodes have been updated.

We can compute the value of (T+d) mod max_delay without explicit reference to the network clock, because compute_moduli_ is called whenever the network clock advances. The various modulos for all available delays are stored in a lookup-table and this table is rotated once per time slice.

briefdescription.para: Initialize modulo table.

detaileddescription.para: TODO: can probably be private

briefdescription.para: Set local spike counter to zero.
Set time measurements for internal profiling to zero (reg.

detaileddescription.para: prep.)

briefdescription.para: Set time measurements for internal profiling to zero (reg.

detaileddescription.para: sim. dyn.)

briefdescription.para: Sets marker in MPI buffer that signals end of communication across MPI ranks.
Reads spikes from MPI buffers and delivers them to ringbuffer of nodes.
Deletes all spikes from spike registers and resets spike counters.
Resizes spike registers according minimal delay so it can accommodate all possible lags.
Removes spikes that were successfully moved to MPI buffers from spike register, such that they are not considered in (potential) next communication round.
Fills MPI buffer for communication of connection information from presynaptic to postsynaptic side.

detaileddescription.para: Builds TargetData objects from SourceTable and connections information.

briefdescription.para: Sets marker in MPI buffer that signals end of communication across MPI ranks.
Reads TargetData objects from MPI buffers and creates Target objects on TargetTable (presynaptic part of connection infrastructure).
Sends event e to all targets of node source.

detaileddescription.para: Delivers events from devices directly to targets.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if spike has been moved to MPI buffer, such that it can be removed by clean_spike_register.
